citeinfo.title: Alaska Orthorectified Radar Intensity Image - USGS National Map 3DEP Downloadable Data Collection

descript.abstract: These data are orthorectified radar intensity images (ORI) derived from interferometric synthetic aperture radar (ifsar) data. An ORI is a high-resolution image derived from ifsar which has geometric distortions removed. Unlike optical imagery, ifsar can be collected in cloudy conditions. The USGS performs minimal quality assurance and no reprocessing of the ORI data. USGS distributes the ORI data as received from the contractors, partners or contributing entities.
descript.purpose: ORIs are used as a primary or ancillary source for digital mapping. They are also used for georeferencing aerial and satellite imagery. Since ORIs highlight topological features they are useful for land cover classification and analysis.
descript.supplinf: The geographic area of coverage of these data are described below in the Bounding Coordinates. Additional information for the ORI data may be found on https://nationalmap.gov/3DEP/. Data may be downloaded through The National Map Viewer: http://nationalmap.gov/viewer.html. Direct links for direct access by automated services are provided in the Distribution section of this metadata.

idinfo.accconst: None. Any downloading and use of these data signifies a user's agreement to comprehension and compliance of the USGS Standard Disclaimer. Insure all portions of metadata are read and clearly understood before using these data in order to protect both user and USGS interests.
idinfo.useconst: There is no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of the data. Users should be aware that temporal changes may have occurred since these data were collected and that some parts of these data may no longer represent actual surface conditions. Users should not use these data for critical applications without a full awareness of its limitations. Acknowledgement of the originating agencies would be appreciated in products derived from these data. Any user who modifies the data is obligated to describe the types of modifications they perform. User specifically agrees not to misrepresent the data, nor to imply that changes made were approved or endorsed by the USGS. Please refer to http://www.usgs.gov/privacy.html for the USGS disclaimer.
idinfo.datacred: Acknowledgement of the originating agencies would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

dataqual.logic: Please refer to the copy of the original product metadata file(s) within the delivered folder if one was provided.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: Please refer to the copy of the original product metadata file(s) if one was provided.

vertacc.vertaccr: Please refer to the copy of the original product metadata file(s) if one was provided.

procstep.procdesc: Original project data were provided to the National Geospatial Technical Operations Center (NGTOC) in Rolla, MO and/or Denver, CO. The data were minimally reviewed for quality. Accuracy was not assessed before publication. Data are provided in the original source resolution and spatial reference.

cntinfo.hours: Monday through Friday 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM Eastern Time Zone USA
cntinfo.cntinst: Please visit http://www.usgs.gov/ask/, call 1-888-ASK-USGS or email tnm_help@usgs.gov to contact us.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by either regarding the utility of the data on any system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. The USGS will warranty the delivery of this product in computer-readable format and will offer appropriate adjustment of credit when the product is determined unreadable by correctly adjusted computer peripherals, or when the physical medium is delivered in damaged condition. Requests for adjustments of credit must be made within 90 days from the date of this shipment from the ordering site.
